stem: Given question: Returning to work was easy for Dan.  He had liked doing nothing for weeks, and after his treatment he was complately what? and answer: painless, explain why in
no_more_50_words: The question insinuates that Dan was away from work on medical leave, since he had a treatment during this time. One common reason to have a medical treatment is to relieve pain.
150_to_200_words: Dan had just finished a long treatment for a health issue and was now returning to work. He had enjoyed the weeks of doing nothing and was feeling great when it was time to go back. After the treatment he was painless, meaning he was not feeling any physical or mental discomfort or distress. This meant he was in a much better state of mind than he had been before the treatment, and he was able to focus on his work without any distractions. Having gone through this difficult experience, Dan was feeling a sense of relief and accomplishment, which in turn made it easier for him to transition back into his job. The fact that he was painless was a major contributing factor to why he was able to return to work without any trouble.
